results.title: Our time in the garden
results.creator_credit: Ron Blau, Susan Woll and Central Studios
results.brief_description: Fifty-year old films from the home movies of the Blau family, Berlin Jews who lived in the Grunewald until 1933. Striking impressions of a happy life before the coming of Fascism. Made by Ron Blau. Voice of Gerda Blau.

results.title: Our neighbour: Australia
results.creator_credit: Agha Bashir Ahmad, Rashid Khan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: A general survey of Australia, its resources and its work under the Colombo Plan, as seen through the eyes of a student from South-East Asia. This film is the work of two Pakistan students, who came to Australia under the Colombo Plan to study the profession of film-making at the studios of the Films Division of the Department of the Interior.

results.title: Dead or alive 2: Birds [DVD] (D)
results.creator_credit: Takashi Miike, Makoto Okada, Yoshihiro Masuda, Daiei Motion Picture Company, Excellent Film and Toei Video
results.brief_description: This film is an unusual sequel to “Dead or Alive”; unusual in that is has the same two lead actors but virtually nothing else in common with the original in terms of plot. In this instalment (one of three) Sho Aikawa plays Mizuki Okamoto, a hit man hired to execute a member of the Yakuza. But instead the opportunity is missed when a mysterious man beats him to it. Fearing retribution Okamoto flees to the small island of his youth, only to be met by the same assassin whom he discovers is an old friend. Together, the two of them join forces using the proceeds from hits to buy vaccines for Third World children. Despite this set-up, Miike has very little use for the conventions of narrative, preferring to engage in the violent, kinetic excesses that are his signature, not to mention the dabbling in surrealist motifs, flashbacks and asides that often baffle. An intriguing mix of humour and action with redemptive overtones. Cast includes Show Aikawa, Riki Takeuchi, Endo Kenichi, Shinya Tsukamoto and Edison Chen.

results.title: Dead or alive [DVD] (D)
results.creator_credit: Takashi Miike, Kimura Toshiki, Makoto Okada, Ono Katsumi, Daiei Motion Picture Company and Toei Animation
results.brief_description: Kinetic, ultra-violent and uber-cool feature from Japanese director Takashi Miike (Audition) was a hit in Japan immediately spawning a sequel. The narrative concerns the fortunes of a band of Yakuzas, drug trafficking and police attempts to stem the trade whilst engaging in brutal methods to achieve their aims. Narcotics cop Jojima, is on a mission to bring down Ryuichi, a Chinese born gangster. In perusing the case, Jojima faces great personal losses and is soon on a violent collision course with his archenemy. The script, by Ichiro Ryu, contains a youthful exuberance and a sadistically comic edge partnered with gruesome surreal murders and raw depictions of sex and drugs. Whilst the narrative features portraits of the many subcultures competing for space in the Japanese underworld, Miike favours broad depictions of character over complex profiles. But perhaps the reasons for engaging in Miike’s stylistic excesses has more to do with aesthetics in any case, as he utilises slow-motion photography and contrasts it with rapid editing to reflect the shifting, amoral gangster landscape where his protagonists roam. Cast includes: Riki Takeuchi, Sho Aikawa, Renji Ishibashi, Hirotaro Honda, Susumu Terajima and Tomoroh Taguchi.

results.title: Dead men don't wear plaid [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Carl Reiner, David V. Picker, William McEuen, Aspen Film Society and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Steve Martin is Rigby Reardon, the best private eye of all time. Juliet Forrest (Rachel Ward) comes to his office with a case. Her father, a noted scientist, philanthropist and cheesemaker has mysteriously died. A complex trail of clues leads Reardon to “Carlotta’s lists”. Reiner has captured the essence of 1940’s detective films and presents an exciting but “fun” film. Reardon’s special “friends” include Alan Ladd, Barbara Stanwyck, Ray Milland, Burt Lancaster, Humphrey Bogart and Charles Laughton.

results.title: I spell I can't...I can!
results.creator_credit: Edie Collet, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Edie Collet’s beginnings were difficult - her mother died giving birth and she was diagnosed as being handicapped. Collet was raised by her father and siblings to become an educated, well travelled and independent adult. Collet was told she would never work but she proved them wrong. This story is dedicated to Collet’s dad.

results.title: In memory of Mark and Dusty
results.creator_credit: Denise Thompson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: It is ten years since the tragic passing of Denise Thompson’s son Mark and the family dog Dusty. A loving tribute by a mother to her son and the pet dog he gave her when he was little.

results.title: Grumpy old man
results.creator_credit: Richard Bailey, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Richard Bailey has nudged and niggled people and he’s had some success, especially on the asbestos issue. A heart attack in 2003 meant that Bailey couldn’t be as active anymore, so he decided to direct his energies elsewhere.

results.title: Dead man
results.creator_credit: Jim Jarmusch, Demetra MacBride, 12-Gauge Productions and Pandora Films
results.brief_description: Filmed in stunning black and white by cinematographer Robby Muller, Jim Jarmusch has established a surreal tone for this visually poetic meditation on life and death. Dead Man is the tale of William Blake (Johnny Depp), a naive Ohio accountant who travels west to a primitive frontier outpost called Machine in expectation of a job that’s already been filled. Within a short space of time Blake is involved in a showdown and finds himself wounded and on the run. Pursued by vicious bounty hunters, Blake is looked after by Nobody (Gary Farmer) an Eastern-educated Indian who believes his new friend is the dead British poet and mystic William Blake.Gradually, Blake comes to fulfill his designated role as the most wanted man in this corner of the west, all the while preparing for life’s ultimate journey. Accompanied by the haunting music of Neil Young, cameo roles by Robert Mitchum, John Hurt and Iggy Pop, and a strong cast including Lance Henriksen, Michael Wincott, Mili Avital and Gabriel Byrne, makes Dead Man an experience not to be missed. Note: Widescreen format.

results.title: A Little bit of willpower
results.creator_credit: Leanda Bunn, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Kicked out of home at the age of 15 and struggling with depression, Leanda Bunn still managed to complete her VCE, find accommodation and be independent thanks to a few very special people in her life and a lot of willpower.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Leanda Bunn, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
